intro: Zuccangnia serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant prefers well-drained, loamy soils and partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Zuccangnia serotina is often found in woodland edges and open meadows, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
